data.title: The Salmon!
data.text: Excellent Salmon! Dinner menu on the weekends that is quite unexpected. Come for drinks but stay for dinner. I will be back!

data.title: Hands down my favorite lunch spot in Terre Haute.
data.text: Family owned local restaurant that just does everything right.  Great service - great food- good atmosphere and a fair price.  I love their pork tenderloin and I especially like the grilled Asian vegetables that I have them add grilled chicken,  Soups are very good - love the onion rings and hot chips too!  Everything is great!

data.title: Family Owned Local Family Restaurant - Value!
data.text: We were stopping overnight in Terre Haute at the Hampton Inn along the highway and were faced with a bunch of chain restaurants for dinner.  We asked for a locally owned alternative and were directed to The Saratoga a few miles away in downtown Terre Haute.  On street parking was available as is a free lot behind the restaurant.  While not a chic décor or contemporary ambiance, the old restaurant is updated, very nice, clean, and not a dive. Everyone was very friendly, personable and accommodating. The menu is extensive with a lot of fried foods and some Mediterranean specialties.  We found the wine list very reasonable. The chicken parm was ok but the pasta was a little overcooked. Overall my conclusion was a nice friendly family owned place with no loud families, attentive service and very reasonable prices (bottle of wine and two dinners for $63 plus tip).  It seemed like the owners were on-site, working, and making sure everyone is happy with the food and service.  We were.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Good service and food for terre haute. 5 of us ate there and were pleasantly surprised. Dessert was good also

data.title: Always a good date night
data.text: My fiancée and I frequented the Saratoga for our date nights. Really delicious food and an extremely friendly staff. I highly recommend the black bean burger with tomato chutney. HEAVENLY.

data.title: Our Friday night go-to!
data.text: Great prime rib, homemade desserts, great bar and the servers (especially Reggie) are spot on. You can't go wrong here!

data.title: Romantic adventure
data.text: Wonderful food, even better deserts! Mixed drinks from the bar are the best in Terre Haute. Try sitting outside for the best Ambiance... The dining area is slightly dated.

data.title: the prime rib is excellent
data.text: Good food and service at a moderate price.  Small quiet atmosphere. Never rushed or hurried. convenient to the university.

data.title: My Favorite Terre Haute Restaurant
data.text:
A wondeful long time family owned establishment. Some of the best food, best bartender in Don with the greatest hosts George, Cathy and now Alexis of any restaurant around. Their homa made desserts are to die for. They have a fantastic all around menu but serve Middle Eastern cuisine one Thursday a month which is fantastic and raw kibby on Mondays which is about as good as it gets.

I just cant say enough about the wonderful owners throughout the many, many years. There has been no place that has seen as many business, political and legal deals made over a drink and a handshake as in the Saratoga. One of the original owners was known as the "Mayor of Downtown Terre Haute".

data.title: Great atmosphere, people, and meals
data.text: My favorite old time dining in downtown Terre Haute. White table cloths, great dinners, Middle East specials on Thursdays and even raw kibbee on Mondays.  Family dining room with bar in next room.  Wonderful desserts.  Steaks, burgers, salads, pork, etc.

data.title: One of My Favorite Local Eats
data.text: Always have wonderful service here.  Came for my birthday lunch with my boss and they gave me a free dessert for my birthday.  Italian Cream Cake...YUM!  Food is always hot and delicious!  Definitely go.

data.title: Historic Crossroad Stopover
data.text: Have been there and seen it .. wanted to make sure all are aware of this great place .To be there was a treat.

data.title: A nice meal, nothing spectacular
data.text: We stopped here during a recent visit to Terre Haute, wanting to avoid chain restaurants.  It was a Thursday evening and business was slow, so we were seated quickly and our server was attentive, explaining the specials and taking our order.  Our food was served pretty quickly and we enjoyed the meal after a long drive, but bottom line, while there wasn't anything wrong with it, it wasn't outstanding either.  I had fish and my partner had chicken; both were ok.  I know no one wants an "average" rating, but nothing really set this apart from other dining experiences.  Again, the staff was friendly and the service was fine.

data.title: Don't pass up The Saratoga
data.text: Family owned and operated, it is a legend in Terre Haute.  Absolutely the best prime rib anywhere!  Also, incredible desserts made by Cathy Azar who owns the Saratoga with her husband.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Say hi to George, Cathy & Alexis
data.text: THE BEST PRIME RIB AND DESSERTS IN TOWN!. Don or Shelly will serve you your favorite cocktail just how you like it.

data.title: Just OK
data.text: Very slow service.  Had the feeling that we were outsiders and the locals were taken care of first.  Food was mediocre at best.  Would not return.

data.title: Prime rib
data.text: best prime rib in town , but not every night, service is brisk sometimes...could be better, the environment has nothing warm, the food is good

data.title: Been doing it since 1942.... they know how to do it!
data.text:
On a recent getaway, we stayed one night in Terre Haute.  After checking into our hotel and resting a bit, we decided it was time for dinner.  So about 6:30 we headed out - drove a short distance to a downtown eater.  I had selected the Saratoga restaurant.  I knew that they were highly rated by TripAdvisor and they have been in business longer than I have been alive.  I am always eager to visit a restaurant that has been around for a long time - 1942 in this case.  

Our curiosity was rewarded with a good dining experience - good, friendly service, excellent food and pleasant surroundings.  Joan had tilapia which was encrusted with crushed up corn tortilla chips, onion rings and glazed carrots.  I had one of their specials: pork chops with a mango chutney.  My meal included a side salad and Lyonnaise potatoes (which I learned is a fancy word for sliced potatoes and onion.

We even had room for some dessert.  Joan had a piece of chocolate cake which she said was very good.  I had a slice of coconut cream pie which was okay (I wouldn’t order it again).  But all in all, a nice experience.

With tax and gratuity: $53.00.

data.title: Wonderful anniversary meal!
data.text: My wife and I went to this wonderful restaurant in order to celebrate our wedding anniversary. It is a classic gem in downtown Terre Haute, IN, and it has a wonderful atmosphere and menu. I had been here twice before, once with my wife and her sister’s family, and once following my son’s graduation from Rose-Hulman. The food has always been superb. This time we had two appetizers: their hummus plate and their Asian/wasabi calamari. They were very well prepared and tasty. We also had a wonderfully sweet red wine with our meal. The entrée that my wife selected was their evening special for that night, chicken marinara with feta cheese. I had their Mediterranean shrimp, made with rosemary and parsley mixed in with feta cheese and olive oil. It had a wonderful flavor. My only issue with the dish was the small number of shrimp that I received; but as they were large shrimp, it really didn’t matter. My Caesar salad was wonderful, as was my potato dish, which is called lyonnaise potatoes, and is a mixture of fried potatoes and onions. We finished our meal with dessert; my wife had their chocolate cake, and I had their coconut cream pie. Their prices are very reasonable; each of us had an appetizer, entrée, dessert, and coffee, and we shared a bottle of wine, all for less than $40 per person. I would recommend any item on the menu; their specialties are their steak and prime menu, along with their Mediterranean dishes. I’ve never had any of their breakfast items, but I am confident that they would be delicious as well. Keep up the good work, George, Cathy, and Alexis; we will return soon.

data.title: Great restaurant
data.text: Great prime rib on the weekends. All dishes are served fresh and flavorful. The service is always outstanding.
